item.title: Speed Bumps - Non Compliant -No Planning- No Permission, 8th April
item.description:
My Neighbour has installed 3 Speed bumps outside his property. One is approx 17 feet from the middle one and then approx 28 feet to the 3rd one. This section of road is privately owned and serves No 18-No 24 Milliner Crescent. Whilst private, delivery vehicles, ambulances, fire engine etc require access. Planning may be required? The Speed bumps do not comply with the minimum published distance and due to the very short distance between them it is not possible to drive over them at the recommend speed. In addition they are an eyesore and as we are trying to sell our property have become a very negative issue. My understanding on a shared access private road all parties would need to have been consulted and given their consent

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Milliner Crescent, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Masses of broken glass and wooden frame, 8th April
item.description:
Alleyway outside 45 & 47 Ermin Street, Brockworth. Lots of glass has been fly tipped with a wood frame. Glass has shattered causing problems for hedgehogs and wild life also for children running through and bicycles which often charge through this alleyway,. Unless it is cleaned up there could be a nasty accident. Some neighbours have already tried cleaning it up, but there is just too much glass!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Ermin Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Health and Saftey Issue, 8th April
item.description:
Behind houses 36, 34, 32, 30 and 28, there is a public alleyway where us residents have access from our gardens. This has now become a health and safety issue as we can not use this as the area is overgrown with plants and also litter, which has been attached. One of my neighbours mentioned that their oil delivery has been refused because they can't get access to their back gate. Could this please be looked into as soon as you are able? All the residents are worried that if we were to have a fire at the front of the house, our only escape route would be our back gates which we can't access. Any help on this matter would be gratefully appreciated or even who we could contact to get this sorted. Thank you and best wishes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Fiddlers Green Lane, Fiddler's Green, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
